instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro with USB-C issue
threads.message:
I have a 2017 Pro board that came in with no power and heavy liquid damage on the logic board underside. I replaced around 25 components in the USB-C power circuitry and the board successfully starts up now and works. 

The USB-C ports work for charging and but they don’t recognize my external drives. I’m obviously missing some data path functionality in the USB circuitry… where to look?

Interestingly, the drives are recognized in startup manager (option during startup). They also work when I load Big Sur, but not Monterey or Ventura.
